meanings.definition: To spend or use (money, time, etc.) unwisely or wastefully.
meanings.sent1: She tends to misspend her allowance on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misspend your savings on things you don't need.
meanings.sent3: He realized he had misspent all his money on useless gadgets.
meanings.sent4: Her brother warned her not to misspend her time on trivial matters.
meanings.sent5: The careless shopper would always misspend her earnings on frivolous purchases.

meanings.definition: To waste or squander (resources, opportunities, etc.).
meanings.sent1: The company cannot afford to misspend its limited resources.
meanings.sent2: It is a shame to misspend such great opportunities that come your way.
meanings.sent3: He would often misspend his chances to excel by procrastinating.
meanings.sent4: She regretted how she had misspent her talents in her youth.
meanings.sent5: The team's failure was a result of their tendency to misspend their potential on trivial tasks.
